channel.title: Code on Jaidev's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Code on Jaidev's Blog

item.title: The Bridge of Asses: Learning Coding with Novices
item.description: Over the last few years, I have been deeply involved with the IIT-M Programme in Data Science & Applications - as a student, a mentor and an analytics consultant. The programme provides diplomas and bachelor’s degrees in data science and applications. I’m often asked why I’m so invested in the programme - especially since I’m already an experienced data scientist. At least three people are mad at me for being in the programme.

item.title: A Process for Readable Code
item.description: I took a course on data structures and algorithms over the last few months. It is being offered as a part of IIT Madras’ Online Degree Program in Data Science and Programming, taught by Prof Madhavan Mukund. The program is a MOOC in a true sense, with tens of thousands of students enrolling each year. The DSA course itself is offered every trimester, and sees an average of ~700 enrollments every time.
